When finished I put the thermo lid on the ice bath along with the airtight cover that I purchased separately, so it would be ready to use <DATE_TIME>. When I came back to the ice bath <DATE_TIME>, half of the water was gone. I noticed there was significant leak along the drain tap.

I was very excited to use this product but with this defect it will be very inconvenient and very timely to fill it with water every day. I would very much like a new portable ice bath.

Please advise on how to proceed.

Thank you,
<PERSON>
response:
Dear <PERSON>,

Thank you for reaching out to us. We apologize for the leak in your Portable Ice Bath. To resolve this, please follow these steps: Unscrew the drainage tap, check the gasket seal is flat, and re-secure the tap tightly. If issues persist or you need further assistance, contact us for a replacement.

Best regards,
<PERSON>Customer Support

Agent's Message: Hello <PERSON>
That appears to be <PERSON> or Cloven-lip toadflax. It's not part of the mix and is most likely a stray dropped by a bird when flying over your garden. response:
Hello <PERSON>,
It's great to hear that you're enjoying your meadow! As the season changes, it's normal for plants to start leaning and looking a bit tired. You can certainly cut back any plants that are falling over or looking unsightly. If it's too dense to mow, using a weed whacker or shears would work just fine. Just be sure to leave about 6 inches of growth so the plants can properly prepare for <DATE_TIME>.
Please let us know if we can be of further assistance and thank you for sharing these wonderful photos with us.
Kind regards,

Customer's Message: Thanks, it worked.
Agent's Message: Hi Lafayette,
Thank you for reaching out, and we're sorry to hear about the charging issue with your watch.
To troubleshoot and resolve the problem, please try the following steps:
Check Charging Cable:
Ensure that the charging cable is securely connected to both the watch and the power source.
Inspect the cable for any damage, and if possible, try an alternate charging cable to rule out a faulty cable.
Power Source:
Try charging your watch from a different power source, such as a different USB port or an alternate charger.
Restart Your Watch:
Perform a restart on your watch. This can sometimes resolve minor issues.
Clean Charging Ports:
Inspect the charging ports on both the watch and the cable for any dirt or debris. Gently clean them using a soft, dry brush or compressed air.
If the issue persists after trying these steps, please let me know. Thanks again!

<URL>
Customer's Message: Thanks, the fan in the Hub is making the noise and it's not being caused by cable contact as far as I can see.
A replacement would be great.

Would it be possible to also get a set of the footpads? And is there a version of the Hub case thatʻs opaque like the drive case? <PERSON> consider paying for that as an upgrade.
Agent's Message: It could be as simple as a cable errantly touching the fan. Whatever issues you had initially setting it up should not persist on powering it down. First step is to determine if it is the Evergreen Hub or the drive making noise, both have a fan. Whichever one is the source, power it down and remove the four footpads on the bottom. This exposes the phillips head screws. Remove this and inspect to see if a cable is touching a fan. If not the fan might be bad and if so we can send a replacement.
Customer's Message: My starter kit spent a long time in transit and I struggled to get it setup but itʻs been working for <DATE_TIME> now.
However starting <DATE_TIME> something in the kit is making a loud humming sound. Sounds like a drive problem (or fan, not sure there are any fans).
I donʻt see any obvious problems inspecting the info thatʻs surfaced in the app.
Iʻd rather not teardown the system since itʻs working but the noise is bothersome.
What course of action would you recommend?
response:
Hi there,

The larger fan is actually the better one. It's worth noting that instead of plugging the 2 pin cable into the old port, you'll want to affix it to the pins on the side of the device. The pins should be color-coded and you'll want to locate the pins in the corner with black and red, and plug in the 2 pins aligned to those colors. The fan should immediately turn on. If you need further assistance, please book a meeting where I can help you add it.

Best,
<PERSON>

Subject:
Re: <PERSON>,

I understand how frustrating it can be when a product doesn't work as expected. We do want to make sure that all of our products are in perfect condition and functioning well. <PERSON> leather is thin and stretchy and because of this, this particular cutter will not handle this material well in thin layers.

Can you please try to cut a few layers of vinyl, leather or several layers of fabric and see how it works. One thing that may help would be if you put a stiff interfacing in front and in behind of the faux leather, or put a layer of stiff leather in front.

The cutter doesn't work for all fibres, and that is why it is a free item that we put in complimentary with the press. It doesn't work for every situation, so this is why we link to a preferred punch in the listing as well. I am afraid an exchange will not benefit your results for this free item. It does work well with different materials, and I hope you can use it for different applications.

I don’t understand why I was sent a replacement of only one charm when I am sure this is not new information for you guys. You should’ve sent me a completely new order.

So now I have the original necklace with three charms on it, one of which is damaged and is impossible to get off. And then a separate necklace with one of my dogs on it. What am I supposed to do with this? I was really excited for this purchase and it turns out you guys must not understand how your products work. What am I supposed to do? I think that I deserve to have a replacement chain with all three of my dogs reprinted. I don’t know what I’m supposed to do with two pieces I cannot combine. As I’m sure you can see. <PERSON>
"Carmen" is an exquisite fragrance, a symphony of contrasts
where the opulence of exotic spices dances with the richness
of woodland enchantments. This scent is a masterfully
composed tapestry, beckoning you on a journey of sensory
allure that begins with a bold declaration of seductive
fruitiness, meanders through a landscape of intoxicating
florals and spices, and culminates in a resonant embrace of
deep, woody warmth.

💫 Top Note: Black Cherry Rhapsody Carmen opens with a
captivating overture of Black Cherry, a melody of dark,
luscious fruitiness that enwraps you in its voluptuous
charm. This initial encounter is both tantalizing and
inviting, blending the cherry's deep sweetness with a subtle
hint of tartness, creating an atmosphere of mystique and
anticipation.

💫 Heart Note: Spiced Floral Elegance At its heart, <PERSON>
unfurls a tapestry of exotic spices and delicate florals.
The warmth of <PERSON> and the luxurious allure of Saffron
interweave, forming an enchanting spice-laden breeze. This
spicy infusion is softened by the tender touch of
Heliotrope, a floral whisper that adds a creamy, almond-like
sweetness, balancing the intensity of the spices with its
gentle caress.

💫 Base: Woodland Resonance In its final act, <PERSON> settles
into a rich, woody base. The comforting essence of Fir
Balsam melds seamlessly with the noble strength of Cedar,
evoking the serene depth of ancient forests. This woody
foundation is elevated by the sophisticated touch of
Ambergris, adding a refined, almost marine-like elegance
that lingers on the skin, a testament to the fragrance's
enduring charm.

💫 For the Bold and the Beautiful Carmen is a fragrance for
the bold, for those who embrace the complexities of life
with passion and elegance. It is a scent that speaks to the
fearless heart, to the individual who is captivated by the
dance of contrasts, finding beauty in the blend of darkness
and light, spice and sweetness, strength and softness. With
its rich, multifaceted character, <PERSON> is more than a
fragrance; it is a declaration of confidence, a celebration
of sophistication.

, which will specifically address the exact issues you had with the Atom Pro 2. I think if we upgrade you to the BTE it will be perfect for you.
I <IN_PAN> that you might not be open to a behind the ear device, and a lot of our customers said the same thing at first, but after trying the Audien BTE they found that it actually worked better for them than in-ear devices.
The main <IN_PAN> users face with the Atom Pro 2 are solved by the BTE:
Size/fit -
If the Atom Pro 2 didn't fit comfortably in your ears, the BTE <IN_PAN> will. Since only the earbud goes in your ear canal instead of the whole unit, the BTE can fit into ears as small as a child's.
Feedback -
While the Atom Pro 2 has great sound quality, it can still have some feedback because the <IN_PAN> sits in your ear canal. With the BTE, this problem is solved because the <IN_PAN> is on the device which sits outside of the ear.
Power & sound quality -
The Audien BTE is the most powerful device we have available. If you had any problems with power or sound quality on the Atom Pro 2, the BTE will <IN_PAN> it.
<IN_PAN> -
If you're worried about how the BTE will look, it actually is more invisible when worn compared to in-ear devices. Since it fits behind your ear, it can only be seen from behind you, but when someone is looking at your face it can't be seen.
The Audien BTE typically retails for $489, however what I can do is upgrade you from your Atom Pro 2 to the BTE for only $80.

) bulbs are not cold hardy in <NRP> planting zone 5. In cooler zones 1-7, they must be started indoors and can be moved outdoors in <DATE_TIME>. Here's how to care for them:
Plant the Ranunculus a sunny location in well-drained soil. Ranunculus loves moisture during the growing period and drier conditions as <DATE_TIME> progresses – so a spot with good drainage is a must. After the growing season ends, lift the tubers and store them in a cool, dry, dark place over <DATE_TIME>, replanting them in <DATE_TIME> after all danger of frost has passed.

Agent's Message: If you are experiencing feedback/whistling from your hearing aids, don't worry, this is a normal <IN_PAN> when inserting them. I suggest you gently press the hearing aid deeper into your ear canal until this feedback stops. The <IN_PAN> is the cause of this sound, and once you have adjusted the hearing aid to the correct position, it should go away!
Also,
1) Feedback upon insertion is expected. It's normal to occur with in-ear devices. The main thing is that the feedback should only happen when getting the device inserted, and once it's inserted properly, there should be minimal to zero feedback.
2) Volume will affect feedback during insertion. Set the volume to level 1 before inserting to avoid it <IN_PAN>. Just hold the units close to your ears, click the buttons to set volume to live 1, and then insert them.
3) It's hard to avoid touching the <IN_PAN> when grabbing the device, and the closer your hand is to the mic, the more likely it is to cause feedback. So the best way to insert the device is by holding it by the pull wire, which is the farthest point away from the unit. Hold the unit by the pull wire, and let your fingers gently support the unit from the back, which is also the complete opposite side of the mic.
